body:
# Docker [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/jeromegn/docker.cr.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/jeromegn/docker.cr) [![Dependency Status](https://shards.rocks/badge/github/jeromegn/docker.cr/status.svg)](https://shards.rocks/github/jeromegn/docker.cr) [![devDependency Status](https://shards.rocks/badge/github/jeromegn/docker.cr/dev_status.svg)](https://shards.rocks/github/jeromegn/docker.cr)

Docker API client in Crystal.

## Installation

Add this to your application's `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
  docker:
    github: jeromegn/docker.cr
```

## Status: Developer Preview

This is not nearly complete. Just got the initial connecting working and simple casting. I added a few commands as a proof of concept.

This shard extends OpenSSL and HTTP::Client a little bit to support Docker's SSL method (TLS V1.)

## Usage

```crystal
require "docker"
```

### Options

By default, options will be taken from the environment variables:

```
DOCKER_URL or DOCKER_HOST
DOCKER_VERIFY_TLS
DOCKER_CERT_PATH
```

but they can also be set manually like:

```crystal
Docker.client.url = "tcp://192.168.99.100:2376"
Docker.client.verify_tls = true
Docker.client.cert_path = "#{ENV["HOME"]}/.docker"
```

If nothing is set, this client will use the unix socket.

### Info

```crystal
Docker.client.info.container # => Returns container count
```

### Containers

```crystal
Docker.client.containers # => Array of Docker::Container
container = Docker.client.containers.first
p container # => #<Docker::Container:0x10f6a3ea0 @id="cbbeb51f25b4c91b61e6d1b5fc0c1c2bb470ccd8aaf5dc4a57885f35f21d7245", @names=["api"], @image="ruby" ...>

container.stop
container.start
container.restart
container.kill
```

## Contributing

1. Fork it ( https://github.com/jeromegn/docker.cr/fork )
2. Create your feature branch (git checkout -b my-new-feature)
3. Commit your changes (git commit -am 'Add some feature')
4. Push to the branch (git push origin my-new-feature)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [jeromegn](https://github.com/jeromegn) Jerome Gravel-Niquet - creator, maintainer

types.name: APIClient
types.doc: The Docker::APIClient contains all of the methods created by the various files.
types.summary: The Docker::APIClient contains all of the methods created by the various files.

def.name: cert_path
def.body:
if cert_path.nil?
  cert_path = ENV["DOCKER_CERT_PATH"]? || DEFAULT_CERT_PATH
end
@cert_path

instance_methods.name: cert_path=
instance_methods.doc:
Also accessible via DOCKER_CERT_PATH environment variable.
If the envvar is not empty or this varable is not nil, it must be a path
to a directory on the filesystem which contains the following files
containing a valid SSL certificate:
 - ca.pem
 - key.pem
 - cert.pem

Setting cert_path and not having these files present will raise an
exception.
instance_methods.summary: Also accessible via DOCKER_CERT_PATH environment variable.

def.name: cert_path=
def.body:
spawn do
  if File.directory?(path)
  else
    raise("required SSL, but no such file found at #{path} or no path specified")
  end
end
{% for f in [:ca, :key, :cert] of ::Symbol %}
      spawn do
        unless File.exists?("{{ f.id }}.pem")
          raise "required SSL and #{path}/{{ f.id }}.pem was not found"
        end
      end
      {% end %}
@cert_path = path

instance_methods.args_string: (id_or_name : String, *, since : String? = nil, before : String? = nil)

def.body:
containers(all: true, since: since, before: before).select do |container|
  (container.id == id_or_name) || (container.names.includes?(id_or_name))
end.map do |container|
  if (names = container.names).empty?
    Docker::Container.new(container.image, container.id)
  else
    Docker::Container.new(container.image, container.id, names)
  end
end

instance_methods.args_string: (id_or_name : Regex, *, since : String? = nil, before : String? = nil)

def.body:
containers(all: true, since: since, before: before).select do |container|
  (container.id.match(id_or_name)) || (!container.names.select do |n|
    n.match(id_or_name)
  end.empty?)
end.map do |container|
  if (names = container.names).empty?
    Docker::Container.new(container.image, container.id)
  else
    Docker::Container.new(container.image, container.id, names)
  end
end

instance_methods.name: containers
instance_methods.args_string: (all : Bool = false, limit : Int32? = nil, since : String? = nil, before : String? = nil, size : Bool = false, filters = {} of String => Array(String))

def.name: containers
def.body:
Docker::Container::ListResponse.request(all: all, limit: limit, since: since, before: before, size: size, filters: filters).map do |container|
  if (names = container.names).empty?
    Docker::Container.new(container.image, container.id)
  else
    Docker::Container.new(container.image, container.id, names)
  end
end

def.name: create
def.body:
names = [] of String
if name && (name.match(NAME_REGEX))
  names << name
end
new(image: image, id: "not yet created", names: names, warnings: warnings).create(**kwargs)

constructors.name: get
constructors.doc:
returns the first container matching the given ID or name, or raise a
Docker::APIClient::NotFound it's not found. In the case that multiple are
found, a Docker::APIClient::Exception will be raised. To get multiple
matching containers, use Docker::Containers[] or
Docker::Containers.containers, which return instead a (possibly empty)
list of all matching containers.
constructors.summary: returns the first container matching the given ID or name, or raise a Docker::APIClient::NotFound it's not found.

def.name: get
def.body:
if (containers = Docker::Containers[id_or_name]).size == 1
  container = containers[0]
  new(container.image, container.id, container.names)
else
  if containers.size == 0
    raise(Docker::APIClient::NotFound.new("container", id_or_name))
  else
    raise(Docker::APIClient::Exception.new("multiple containers found with the name #{id_or_name}. Use Docker::Containers.[]() instead."))
  end
end

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (image : String | Docker::Tag, id, names = [] of String, warnings = STDERR)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(image, id, names, warnings)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: create
def.body:
path = if (name = names[0]?).nil?
  "/containers/create"
else
  "/containers/create?name=#{name}"
end
response = Docker.client.post(path, body: (CreateBody.new(image, **kwargs)).to_json)
if response.status_code == 200
  body = Hash(String, String | Array(String)).from_json(response.body)
  if (  warn_text = body["Warnings"]).is_a?(Array(String))
    warn_text.each do |warning|
      @warnings.puts(warning)
    end
  else
    if warn_text.is_a?(String)
      @warnings.puts(warn_text)
    end
  end
  @id = body["Id"].as(String)
  self
else
  handle_response(path, response, :create)
end

instance_methods.name: get?
instance_methods.doc:
returns the first container matching the given ID or name, or nil if
it's not found. In the case that multiple are found, only the first will
be returned. To get multiple matching containers, use
Docker::Containers[] or Docker::Containers.containers, which return
instead a (possibly empty) list of all matching containers.
instance_methods.summary: returns the first container matching the given ID or name, or nil if it's not found.

def.name: get?
def.body:
if container = Docker::Containers[id_or_name][0]?
  new(container.image, container.id, container.names)
end

def.name: kill
def.body:
if id.empty?
  raise("invalid empty id for container named #{names} with image #{image}")
else
  post("/containers/#{id}/kill", :killed)
end

instance_methods.name: logs
instance_methods.args_string: (follow = true, stdout = true, stderr = true, since = 0, timestamps = false)

def.name: logs
def.body:
params = HTTP::Params.build do |qs|
  qs.add("follow", follow.to_s)
  qs.add("stdout", stdout.to_s)
  qs.add("stderr", stderr.to_s)
  qs.add("since", since.to_s)
  qs.add("timestamps", timestamps.to_s)
end
Docker.client.client.get("/containers/#{id}/logs?#{params}") do |response|
  if response.status_code == 200
  else
    raise("unexpected status code #{response.status_code}")
  end
  begin
    response.body_io.each_line do |line|
      print(line)
    end
  rescue e
    puts(e)
    response.body_io.close
  end
end

def.name: restart
def.body:
if id.empty?
  raise("invalid empty id for container named #{names} with image #{image}")
else
  post("/containers/#{id}/restart?t=#{wait}", :restarted)
end

a warning on the

instance_methods.name: as_keys
instance_methods.doc:
the unique elements from the Indexable "values" is converted to an
object in the given builder, where the values from the indexable are the
keys, mapped to empty values, like
`{"value one" => {}, "value two" => {}}`
instance_methods.summary: the unique elements from the Indexable "values" is converted to an object in the given builder, where the values from the indexable are the keys, mapped to empty values, like {"value one" => {}, "value two" => {}}

def.name: as_keys
def.body:
builder.object do
  if values.responds_to?(:uniq)
    values.uniq.each do |v|
      builder.object do
        builder.field(v, builder.object do
        end)
      end
    end
  else
    values.each do |v|
      builder.object do
        builder.field(v, builder.object do
        end)
      end
    end
  end
end

The entry point for the container as a string or an array of strings.

If the array consists of exactly one empty string ([""]) then the entry
point is reset to system default (i.e., the entry point used by docker
when there is no `ENTRYPOINT` instruction in the `Dockerfile`).

def.name: to_json
def.body:
builder.object do
  {% for attr, str in StrAttrs %}
            builder.field {{ str }}, {{ attr.id }} unless {{ attr.id }}.nil?
          {% end %}
  {% for attr, str in DefaultFalseAttrs %}
            builder.field {{ str }}, {{ attr.id }}.to_s unless {{ attr.id }}.nil?
          {% end %}
  {% for attr, str in DefaultTrueAttrs %}
            builder.field {{ str }}, "true" if {{ attr.id }}
          {% end %}
  if env?.nil? || env?.not_nil!.empty?
  else
    builder.field("Environment") do
      builder.array do
        env?.not_nil!.to_a.each do |e|
          builder.string(e)
        end
      end
    end
  end
  if (  ports = exposed_ports?).nil?
  else
    builder.field("ExposedPorts") do
      as_keys(ports, builder)
    end
  end
  if (  img = image?).nil?
  else
    builder.field("Image", img)
  end
  if (  vols = volumes?).nil?
  else
    if vols.empty?
    else
      builder.field("Volumes") do
        as_keys(vols, builder)
      end
    end
  end
  if (  ept = entrypoint?).nil?
  else
    if ept.is_a?(String)
      builder.field("Entrypint", ept.as(String))
    else
      builder.field("Entrypoint") do
        builder.array do
          (ept.as(Array(String))).each do |e|
            builder.string(e)
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end
  if (  lbls = labels?).nil?
  else
    if lbls.empty?
    else
      builder.object do
        lbls.each do |k, v|
          builder.field(k, v)
        end
      end
    end
  end
  builder.field("StopSignal", stop_signal)
  builder.field("StopTimeout", stop_timeout)
  if (  sh = shell?).nil?
  else
    if sh.empty?
    else
      builder.field("Shell") do
        builder.array do
          sh.each do |arg|
            builder.string(arg)
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

def.name: to_json
def.body:
strbuf = String::Builder.new
builder = JSON::Builder.new(strbuf)
builder.start_document
to_json(builder)
builder.end_document
strbuf.to_s

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
if interval, timeout, or start_period are less than one million and more
than zero, this will raise an exception. To prevent this behavior, you
can call this `#.new` with an explicit `(..., force: true)`, or set the
property after initializing.

Automatically remove the container when the container's process exits.
This has no effect if `#restart_policy` is set.

def.name: binds
def.body:
if @binds.nil? || @binds.not_nil!.empty?
  return {} of String => String
end
if (nn_binds = _binds).nil? || (_binds.not_nil!.size != @binds.not_nil!.size)
  _binds = {} of String => String
  @binds.not_nil!.each do |binding|
    split = binding.split(":")
    if split.size == 2
    else
      raise("invalid binding #{binding} must have only one ':' in it.")
    end
    _binds[split[0]] = split[1]
  end
end
_binds

class_methods.name: build
class_methods.doc:
Build an image with the given parameters. Context must be one of:
  - a path to a directory to be used as context
  - a path to a .tar file to be used as context
  - an IO which when read will yield a tarfile to be used as context
Note that the dockerfile parameter is a path relative to the context, not
an absolute path.
See https://docs.docker.com/engine/api/v1.30/#operation/ImageBuild
class_methods.summary: Build an image with the given parameters.
class_methods.args_string: (context : String | IO = Dir.current, dockerfile : String? = nil, tag : Array(String)? = nil, extra_hosts : String = nil, remote : String? = nil, no_cache? = false, cache_from : Array(String)? = nil, pull? = false, rm? = true, force_rm? = false, limits = ContainerLimits.new)

def.name: build
def.body:
lim = limits.to_q
q = HTTP::Params.build do |query|
  if (dockerfile == "Dockerfile") || dockerfile.nil?
  else
    query.add("dockerfile", dockerfile)
  end
  tag.nil? || tag.each do |t|
    query.add("t", t)
  end
  if extra_hosts.nil?
  else
    query.add("extrahosts", extra_hosts)
  end
  if remote.nil?
  else
    query.add("remote", remote)
  end
  if no_cache?
    query.add("nocache", "true")
  end
  if cache_from.nil?
  else
    query.add("cachefrom", cache_from)
  end
  if pull?
    query.add("pull", "true")
  end
  if rm?
  else
    query.add("rm", "false")
  end
  if force_rm?
    query.add("forcerm", "true")
  end
end
query_string = lim.nil? ? q : (lim + '&') + q
if query_string.empty?
else
  query_string = "?" + query_string
end
endpoint = "/build#{query_string}"
if File.directory?(context)
  tf_reader, tf_writer = IO.pipe
  tar_proc = Process.run("tar -c #{context}", output: tf_writer)
  spawn do
    handle_request(endpoint, Docker.client.post(endpoint, body: tf_reader))
  end
  tar_proc.wait
  tf_writer.close
  Fiber.yield
  self
else
  if File.exists?(context && (tarfile_at?(context)))
    File.open(context) do |tarfile|
      handle_request(endpoint, Docker.client.post(endpoint, body: tarfile))
    end
  else
    raise(Docker::APIClient::Exception.new("invalid image file #{context}"))
  end
end
if tarfile_location.nil?
  raise("got nil tarfile location, that shouldn't happen")
end

class_methods.summary: Like Image#export, but retreives multiple images into a single tar file.

def.name: export
def.body:
url = "/images/get?names=#{ids_or_names.join(',')}"
Docker.client.get(url) do |response|
  if response.status_code === 500
    raise(InternalServerError.new(url, response))
  end
  response.body_io.each_byte do |byte|
    yield byte
  end
end

def.name: export
def.body:
File.open(into, perm: 420) do |file|
  self.export(ids_or_names, into: file)
end

  end
  q.add("tag", image_tag.tag)
end
url = "/images/create"
if query.empty?
else
  url = url + ('?' + query)
end
stream_pull_status(url, &block)
Docker::Images.find(image_tag)

instance_methods.name: remove
instance_methods.doc:
Remove this image, pruning untagged parent images by default.
See https://docs.docker.com/engine/api/v1.30/#operation/ImageDelete
instance_methods.summary: Remove this image, pruning untagged parent images by default.

def.name: remove
def.body:
query = HTTP::Params.build do |q|
  if force?
    q.add("force", "true")
  end
  if prune?
  else
    q.add("noprune", "true")
  end
end
if query.empty?
else
  query = '?' + query
end
url = ("/images/" + id) + query
response = Docker.client.delete(url)
case response.status_code
when 200
  o = JSON.parse(response.body?)
  untagged = Slice(String).new
  deleted = Slice(String).new
  o.each do |img|
    if id = img["Untagged"]?
      untagged << id
    else
      if id = img["Deleted"]?
        deleted << id
      end
    end
  end
  return {untagged: untagged, deleted: deleted}
when 404
  raise(NotFound.new(url, response))
when 500
  raise(InternalServerError.new(url, response))
else
  raise(Docker::APIClient::Exception.new("got unexpected status #{response.status} for endpoint #{url}."))
end

Tag an image.

def.name: tag
def.body:
reponse = Docker.client.post("/images/#{id}/tag" + tag_val.to_params)
case response.status_code
when 201
  return self
when 400
  raise(BadParameter.new(url, response))
when 404
  raise(NotFound.new(url, response))
when 409
  raise("Tag #{tag_val} for image #{id} already exists!")
when 500
  raise(InternalServerError.new(url, response))
else
  raise(Docker::APIClient::Exception.new("got unexpected status #{response.status} for endpoint #{url}."))
end

class_methods.name: find
class_methods.doc: Find images tagged with the given tag.
class_methods.summary: Find images tagged with the given tag.

def.name: request
def.body:
params = HTTP::Params.build do |q|
  if all
    q.add("all", "true")
  end
  if filters.none?
  else
    q.add("filters", filters.to_json)
  end
  q.add("digests", "true")
end
response = Docker.client.get("/images/json?#{params}")
begin
  from_json(response.body)
rescue e : JSON::ParseException
  begin
    [Docker::Image.from_json(response.body)]
  rescue JSON::ParseException
    raise(e)
  end
end

self.each do |img|
  if img.id === img_id
    return img
  end
end
raise(Docker::APIClient::NotFound.new("Image", "image ID: #{img_id}"))

self.each do |img|
  if img.id === img_id
    return img
  end
end

def.name: label
def.body:
if @label.nil?
  return nil
end
if @label.is_a?(String)
  @label.as(String)
else
  if @label.is_a?(Tuple(String, String))
    ltpl = @label.as(Tuple(String, String))
    (ltpl[0] + '=') + ltpl[1]
  else
    raise("got unrecognized type for label \"#{@label.inspect}\" with type #{typeof(@label)}")
  end
end

def.name: to_params
def.body:
if none?
  return ""
end
HTTP::Params.build do |q|
  l = label
  if all
    q.add("all", "true")
  end
  if before.nil?
  else
    q.add("before", before.to_s)
  end
  if dangling
  else
    q.add("dangling", "false")
  end
  if l.nil?
  else
    q.add("label", l)
  end
  if reference.nil?
  else
    q.add("reference", reference)
  end
  if since.nil?
  else
    q.add("since", since)
  end
end

def.name: to_json
def.body:
json.object do
  _architecture = @architecture
  if _architecture.nil?
  else
    json.field("Architecture") do
      _architecture.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _containers = @containers
  if _containers.nil?
  else
    json.field("Containers") do
      _containers.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _containers_running = @containers_running
  if _containers_running.nil?
  else
    json.field("ContainersRunning") do
      _containers_running.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _containers_stopped = @containers_stopped
  if _containers_stopped.nil?
  else
    json.field("ContainersStopped") do
      _containers_stopped.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _containers_paused = @containers_paused
  if _containers_paused.nil?
  else
    json.field("ContainersPaused") do
      _containers_paused.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _cpu_cfs_period = @cpu_cfs_period
  if _cpu_cfs_period.nil?
  else
    json.field("CpuCfsPeriod") do
      _cpu_cfs_period.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _cpu_cfs_quota = @cpu_cfs_quota
  if _cpu_cfs_quota.nil?
  else
    json.field("CpuCfsQuota") do
      _cpu_cfs_quota.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _debug = @debug
  if _debug.nil?
  else
    json.field("Debug") do
      _debug.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _discovery_backend = @discovery_backend
  if _discovery_backend.nil?
  else
    json.field("DiscoveryBackend") do
      _discovery_backend.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _docker_root_dir = @docker_root_dir
  if _docker_root_dir.nil?
  else
    json.field("DockerRootDir") do
      _docker_root_dir.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _driver = @driver
  if _driver.nil?
  else
    json.field("Driver") do
      _driver.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _driver_status = @driver_status
  if _driver_status.nil?
  else
    json.field("DriverStatus") do
      _driver_status.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _system_status = @system_status
  if _system_status.nil?
  else
    json.field("SystemStatus") do
      _system_status.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _plugins = @plugins
  if _plugins.nil?
  else
    json.field("Plugins") do
      _plugins.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _execution_driver = @execution_driver
  if _execution_driver.nil?
  else
    json.field("ExecutionDriver") do
      _execution_driver.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _experimental_build = @experimental_build
  if _experimental_build.nil?
  else
    json.field("ExperimentalBuild") do
      _experimental_build.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _http_proxy = @http_proxy
  if _http_proxy.nil?
  else

types.name: Tag
types.doc:
A tag for a particular image

#### For example:
the image for the latest version of crystal is
  `crystallang/crystal:latest`
which has the *repo* `crystallang`, the *image_name* `crystal`, and the
*tag* `latest`.

def.name: from_s
def.body:
repo, image_name, tag = nil, nil, nil
if (string.includes?("/")) && (string.includes?(":"))
  repo, not_repo = string.split("/")
  image_name, tag = not_repo.split(":")
else
  if string.includes?(":")
    image_name, tag = string.split(":")
  else
    if string.includes?("/")
      repo, image_name = string.split("/")
      tag = "latest"
    else
      image_name = string
      tag = "latest"
    end
  end
end
self.new(repo, image_name, tag)

def.name: to_params
def.body:
String.builder do |path|
  path << "repo="
  if repo.nil?
  else
    (path << repo) << "/"
  end
  ((path << image_name) << "&tag=") << tag
end

def.name: to_s
def.body:
if repo.nil?
  (image_name + ":") + tag
else
  (((repo.not_nil! + "/") + image_name) + ":") + tag
end
